item.title: By: Russell Heimlich
item.dc:creator: Russell Heimlich
item.description: I don't know why you're asking. You've clearly already done that just by leaving a comment here.
item.content:encoded: I don’t know why you’re asking. You’ve clearly already done that just by leaving a comment here.

item.title: By: Russell Heimlich
item.dc:creator: Russell Heimlich
item.description:
"target=”_new” is not a standard target value. You could use any term you like and any link that has the same target value will open in a previously spawned window."
See the target=”booger” example above.
item.content:encoded:
“target=”_new” is not a standard target value. You could use any term you like and any link that has the same target value will open in a previously spawned window.”

See the target=”booger” example above.

item.title: By: Paul
item.dc:creator: Paul
item.description:
UPDATE
Whatever substitute name is used for _new, providing that name is used consistently, that window will be repeatedly reused.
However, if we use target="_one" and later target="_two" separate, reusable, windows will be open for both.
Paul.
item.content:encoded:
UPDATE

Whatever substitute name is used for _new, providing that name is used consistently, that window will be repeatedly reused.

However, if we use target=”_one” and later target=”_two” separate, reusable, windows will be open for both.

Paul.

item.title: By: Russell Heimlich
item.dc:creator: Russell Heimlich
item.description: Yup, you should use target="_blank", the underscore is important.
item.content:encoded: Yup, you should use target=”_blank”, the underscore is important.

item.title: By: Raptorak
item.dc:creator: Raptorak
item.description: Thanks for the explanation of the difference! I've been using "new" because I just assumed that meant "open a new window." I had no idea what blank meant. So based on my understanding now, if we want to link to a few sites in a row (for people to read) it may be better to go with blank, whereas if it's just one link we should go with new?
item.content:encoded: Thanks for the explanation of the difference! I’ve been using “new” because I just assumed that meant “open a new window.” I had no idea what blank meant. So based on my understanding now, if we want to link to a few sites in a row (for people to read) it may be better to go with blank, whereas if it’s just one link we should go with new?
